questions.question: Are the expression *ptr++ and ++*ptr are same?
questions.answerDescription: *ptr++ increments the pointer and not the value, whereas the ++*ptr increments the value being pointed by ptr

questions.question: Will the program compile?
questions.answerDescription: C doesn't do array bounds checking at compile time, hence this compiles. But, the modern compilers like Turbo C++ detects this as 'Error: Too many initializers'. GCC would give you a warning.

questions.question: The following program reports an error on compilation.
questions.answerDescription: This program will NOT report any error. (Tested in Turbo C under DOS and GCC under Linux) The output: 10.000000
